translation.title: A Realized One Both Exists and Doesn’t Exist

next.name: A Realized One Neither Exists Nor Doesn’t Exist

segments.en: 17. A Realized One Both Exists and Doesn’t Exist

segments.pli: “Kismiṃ nu kho, bhikkhave, sati, kiṃ upādāya, kiṃ abhinivissa evaṃ diṭṭhi uppajjati:
segments.en: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does the view arise:

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti?
segments.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’?” …

suttaplex.blurb: The view that the Realized One both exists and does not exist after death is given up by seeing the aggregates, as well as what is seen, heard, thought, and known, as impermanent.
